title: A movie with Commander Keen in it, by SilentWulf
content:
Also Jill, Duke, Jump Man, and others. It made me laugh, and have Flashbacks to 1994.

Google Video: [url=http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=891382444423216203&hl=en]video.google.com/videopla...6203&hl=en[/url]

Download WMV (rightclick): [url=http://silentwulf.com/386dos01.wmv]silentwulf.com/386dos01.wmv[/url]

Naturally, it was so popular that Ebaumsworld has already stolen it and is making money off it until the author threatens to sue them, whereupon Ebaums will eventually remove it and replace it with their next stolen work, and so, the cycle repeats.

But anyway, my favourite bit was Jump Man. Even funnier than I remember... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rollhead.gif[/img]
----------

It's a good idea just horrible execution.-----------------------

title: Re: A movie with Commander Keen in it, by SilentWulf
content:
It was OK-ish.
The coolest aspect was seeing all those old games again (never played Jumpman or the VGA remake of LSL though), but the dubbing wasn't funny enough... at least, I'd rather have seen those scenes be related in some way, it just felt too random.
Complete randomness works as well, but then all the individual parts need to be really funny, and I didn't think these were, although maybe the swearing is funny for some.
"You just can't go around" was the best scene, maybe.Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: A movie with Commander Keen in it, by SilentWulf
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Tell Us, Uncle Djaser! [hr][/quote]
Dirk Jan, as an example for comics.
There are plenty of topics about music and movies in the theatre section to find out yourself what my other tastes are.

It's true that my last posts where mainly negative, but that's really coincidence. I can't help it that everybody post so many here lately. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] -----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

I'm not giving this the same negative reaction most other people gave it--I thought it was a cute collection of twists on somewhat-memorable scenes from videogames of our youth. 3/5 stars. I didn't recognize the character at the very end who said "I CAN'T TAKE IT ANYMORE!" but I'd wager that a Lemming would have been more appropriate.
